intro: Hieracium arrhizophyllum, commonly known as the creeping hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and has a sprawling, low-growing habit with runners. Its leaves are usually basal, spoon-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. It is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open areas where it can spread rapidly.
